caption.center: WILLIAM R. HAYES, JR. and IRENE Y. HAYES, Petitioners, v. THE HONORABLE
GARY W.B. CHANG, JUDGE OF THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE FIRST CIRCUIT;
PEREIRA ENTERPRISES, INC., a Hawaii corporation doing business as
MERRY MAIDS; JEANNINE HIPPCHEN-PEREIRA; MERRY MAIDS, INC.; JAY S.

opinion.panel: MOON, C.J., LEVINSON, NAKAYAMA, RAMIL, and ACOBA, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
ORDER Upon consideration of the petition for a writ of mandate filed by Petitioners William R. Hayes, Jr. and Irene Y. Hayes and the papers in support, it appears that: (1) Petitioners ask this court to review a ruling issued by the respondent judge in Hayes v. PereiraEnterprises, Inc., Civil No. 98-0308, presently pending in the Circuit Court of the First Circuit; and (2) Petitioners fail to demonstrate that they are entitled to a writ of mandamus. See Straub Clinic Hospital v.Kochi, 81 Hawai`i 102, 952 P.2d 390 (1996). Therefore,
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the petition for a writ of mandate is denied without prejudice to any remedy Petitioners may have by way of appeal.
